fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Release value got removed when "Empty values only" is selected in the auto-schedule.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a few epics with multiple releases in one project.
 # Click on auto-schedule, select "empty values only" for sprints, releases, and teams. 

h3. Expected Results

Only the empty release values get overwritten after select "Empty values only" in auto-schedule.
h3. Actual Results

Existing release value got removed when "Empty values only" is selected in the auto-schedule
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Portfolio auto-schedule overwrites releases even when Empty values only is selected

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When clicking on the option 'select this and all descendant issues' on an issue without descendants, a UI error is thrown and the plan page is rendered as a blank/white page. The only way to view the plan again, is to clear browser cookies. If you select, 'only descendant issues', the UI error is thrown but the page is not rendered blank. 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a portfolio plan. 
 # Navigate to the plan backlog.
 # Click ... , and then click 'Select this and all descendant issues' on an issue that does not have descendants. 

h3. Expected Results

The issue is selected. 
h3. Actual Results
 * An error 'something went wrong' is displayed in the browser and the page displays as a blank/white page. Screen shot:   !Image 2020-01-10 at 3.49.22 PM.png|thumbnail!
 * Clicking 'View log' on the UI error, shows that a 'TypeError: Cannot read property 'project' of undefined'' is thrown.

h3. Workaround

None. To repair the view in the browser, clear the cookies and caches. Or clear off the Local Storage using your browser's Developer Tools: 
 !Screenshot 2020-01-20 at 5.35.48 PM.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Clicking option 'Select this and all descendant issues' on an issue without descendants throws UI error and renders a blank page

fields.description: This may tie into the Team field being a full supported field. It would be nice if an individual is able to set parameters when querying the team field either JQL or REST API. Limiting how many are pulled back, whether they are public or shared, etc.
fields.summary: Parameters for Team Field

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
* The options in the custom field filter in the new Portfolio experience will be duplicate if the custom field has multiple issue types selected in its context.
* Portfolio will display all possible options from all contexts and issue types. If two contexts have the same option, it will show twice. 
* If a context is configured for multiple issues types, the options configured in this context will show once for each issue type. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a custom field *FieldA* as single-select.
# Select two issue types in custom field's default context.
# Create a Portfolio plan and add *FieldA*. 
# Try to filter the plan based on *FieldA*. 

h3. Expected Results
* The filter will not show duplicates if two or more contexts share the same options. 
* At a minimum, the custom field should not show duplicates from the same context. 
* Ideally, the filter show only show options from the contexts that include the projects shown in the plan. 
* The projects shows in the plan are the same ones included in the Agile boards used by the plan. 

h3. Actual Results
* The filter shows as many values as the total number of issue types per context.
* If no issue type is defined in a context, the values from that context will only be displayed once.
* For example: If the default context has no issue types configured and there's a second context with 4 issue types, values from the default context will show up once and from the second context 4 times. 
* Here's an examples of duplicate values in the filter: 
 !duplicate_options.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
The only workaround is to keep one single context for the custom field with no issues types selected.
fields.summary: The custom field filter display duplicate options if the custom field has multiple contexts or multiple issue types configured in one context

fields.description:
Currently there is no option to lock certain fields from auto scheduling. 

It would be a nice-to-have if you could determine field values and exclude them from the scheduler jobs, so that Portfolio can plan around those instead.
fields.summary: Allow Portfolio fields to be locked from auto scheduling

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Jira Portfolio only displays 1 release per an issue, even though epic can have multiple releases assigned. The dropdown itself when expanded shows multiple releases selected, while only 1 is displayed in the control. This can cause unexpected data loss when modifying Release attribute through Portfolio.

To add to a confusion, the Release displayed out of multiple will always be the last associated with the epic, so it might differ between epics associated with the same releases.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Associate multiple releases to an epic.
 # Check Releases column through the plan - only 1 release is displayed.

h3. Expected Results

Multiple releases displayed in the column.
h3. Actual Results

Last associated Release is displayed.
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Portfolio produces erratic behavior when epics have multiple releases assigned
Setting an issue source where the overall sum of issues in the board exceeds the limit fails even if selecting a version that has less than the limit

fields.description: Currently, when group issues in Portfolio by component let's say, you need to drill into each group to see the individual issues progress, it would be neat if you could see the progress of the entire group without drilling in.
fields.summary: Please add the ability to visualize the progress of issues in a group

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

App will crash when opening the assignee's drop down in a portfolio plan if a user in the drop down has no email. This is rare as email is normally a required field in Jira.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a user without an email, (perhaps directly via DB).
 # Open assignee's cell in the field columns.
 # Search for user with no email

h3. Expected Results

Assignee option just shows name/label (normally also shows email), but does not crash
h3. Actual Results

App will crash with an unhandled exception
{noformat}
TypeError: Cannot read property 'length' of undefined
{noformat}
h3. Workaround

Make sure all users have an email
fields.summary: Opening assignees on fields within a plan can crash the app when users have no email

fields.description: USAA is requesting a set of "Team" level specific permissions. Once a user has access to create teams, you are unable to stop them from transitioning a private team to a shared team. This can cause issues when you're trying to manage shared teams and you're unable to truly lock down the current list without removing "Portfolio for Jira User" permission.
fields.summary: Granular Team Permissions

fields.description:
*Current Behavior:*

When choosing the "1Y" timeline view in Portfolio it divides the year into four quarters and aligns it as:
 * Jan Q1/20
 * Apr Q2/20
 * Jul Q3/20
 * Oct Q3/20

*Suggested Behavior:*

Ability to set the quarters so that it aligns with an organizations fiscal year, and appears as:

 * Jan Q4/20
 * April Q1/20
 * July Q2/20
 * Oct Q3/20

Or alternatively, allow it to align the fiscal year of the organizations first quarter, if a month other than January, so it appears such as:

 * April Q1/20
 * July Q2/20
 * Oct Q3/20
 * Jan Q4/21

Ideally, it would be great if *Jira Administrators* could customize these quarters entirely, setting these values accordingly to their companies' quarterly ranges. It would also be amazing to be able to divide the year into trimesters or semesters as well.
fields.summary: Allow customization of quarters in the '1Y' Plan timeline view

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When issues are scheduled in Portfolio using "Auto schedule" by following steps below, Portfolio schedule issue with more estimates in single Sprint.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 
# Create a new Portfolio plan and connect it to a new Project.
# Create 4 Epics in the plan.
# Set 30 Story points for first 2 Epics & 20 Story points for the last 2 Epic's.
# Create 2 teams in the Portfolio plan. 
# For each team set the Sprint velocity to *20* & Sprint length to *1 week*
# Click on "Auto-schedule".

h3. Expected Results

Portfolio schedule the Epic's to 2 separate Sprints since each Sprint is configured for 20 story points only and the first 2 Epics has more than 20 story points.


h3. Actual Results

!Screenshot 2019-12-23 at 4.14.30 PM.png|thumbnail! 


h3. Workaround

None.
fields.summary: Incorrect scheduling with auto schedule

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Loading a plan and viewing it the roadmap includes an issue(s) with no Priority. Attempting to edit the Issue's Priority results in an empty drop-down list. Consequently the Issue's Priority cannot be viewed or modified.

The server error log indicates that the corresponding Project's Priority Scheme could not be retrieved.

h4. Background

Jira introduced the concept of Priority Schemes in Jira 7.6. In addition to the default scheme, administrators can now create their own schemes with different priorities, relative order and/or default priority. By default, a Project is associated with the default Priority Scheme. A custom Priority Scheme can be associated with a Project by an administrator. A Project should always have a Priority Scheme, either a custom scheme or the default. You can find more information in the [Jira product documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/associating-priorities-with-projects-939514001.html].

In Portfolio 3.4, we added support for the Priority field in the roadmap. This allowed plan users to view/update an issue's Priority from the roadmap. In order to support this, Portfolio loads from Jira the Priority Scheme for each Project in the Plan. It does this so that it can correctly indicate which Priorities are available for an issue and their relative order.

h4. Versions Affected

The underlying issue has been observed by customers on 3.13 and 3.14 and it is expected that all versions from 3.4 onwards are affected as this is when loading Priority Schemes was added. In 3.17 a check was added that minimises the impact.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

The steps to reproduce are unknown at this time. We are raising this ticket to help us gather information about the cause.

It is possible, but not confirmed, that changing a Project's Priority Scheme may be the cause.

h3. Expected Results

While viewing the roadmap, each Issue's Priority should be visible (provided the Priority field has been added to the roadmap). When editing an Issue's Priority, the corresponding drop-down list should contain the Priorities applicable to the Project that the Issue belongs to.

h3. Actual Results

The Issue's Priority field is blank and the corresponding drop-down list is empty:

 !Degraded-Priority-Behaviour.png|thumbnail! 

The following warning is logged in the {{atlassian-jira.log}} file:
{noformat}
No priority scheme for project: <project key>
{noformat}

h3. Workaround

For at least one customer, associating a new Priority Scheme with the affected Project(s) in the Plan resolved the issue. This is configured through the Jira Administration menu, via Issues -> Priority Schemes.

No other workarounds are known at this time.
fields.summary: An issue's priority is missing and editing it displays an empty drop-down list of priorities

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Loading a plan fails and the placeholder roadmap displays indefinitely. 

The error message and stack-trace suggest that Priority Scheme records in the Jira database may have become invalid.

h4. Background

Jira introduced the concept of Priority Schemes in Jira 7.6. In addition to the default scheme, administrators can now create their own schemes with different priorities, relative order and/or default priority. By default, a Project is associated with the default Priority Scheme. A custom Priority Scheme can be associated with a Project by an administrator. A Project should always have a Priority Scheme, either a custom scheme of the default. You can find more information in the [Jira product documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/associating-priorities-with-projects-939514001.html].

In Portfolio 3.4, we added support for the Priority field in the roadmap. This allowed plan users to view/update an issue's Priority from the roadmap. In order to support this, Portfolio loads from Jira the Priority Scheme for each Project in the Plan. It does this so that it can correctly indicate which Priorities are available for an issue and their relative order.

h4. Versions Affected

The issue has been observed by customers on 3.13 and 3.14. It has been replicated internally on 3.16. It is expected that all versions from between 3.4 and 3.16 inclusive are affected by this issue (as 3.4 was when loading Priority Schemes was added, and 3.17 was when mitigation for this issue was added).

h3. Steps to Reproduce

The steps to reproduce are unknown at this time. We are raising this ticket to help us gather information about the cause.

It is possible, but not confirmed, that changing a Project's Priority Scheme may be the cause.

h3. Expected Results

A Portfolio Plan loads as expected.

h3. Actual Results

A Portfolio Plan fails to load and roadmap displays the placeholder screen indefinitely.

The browser's Javascript console reports the following error:
{noformat}
uncaught at ve at ve 
 at he 
 TypeError: Cannot read property 'baselineStartField' of undefined
    at https://<customer site>/s/d41d8cd98f00b204e9800998ecf8427e-CDN/-4bhhew/79002/b71a231329253f5fa6e75e990ad9af8a/<Portfolio Version>/_/download/batch/com.atlassian.jpo:jpo-wr-page-simple-plans-scripts/com.atlassian.jpo:jpo-wr-page-simple-plans-scripts.js:3:495735
{noformat}
The following exception is logged in the {{atlassian-jira.log}} file:
{noformat}
Exception in thread "main" java.lang.NullPointerException
        at com.atlassian.rm.common.bridges.jira.issue.priority.IssuePrioritySchemeServiceBridge76.getIssuePriorityScheme(IssuePrioritySchemeServiceBridge76.java:48)
        at com.atlassian.rm.jpo.env.issuepriority.JiraIssuePriorityService.getIssuePriorityScheme(JiraIssuePriorityService.java:61)
        at com.atlassian.rm.jpo.env.issuepriority.JiraIssuePriorityService.getIssuePriorityInformation(JiraIssuePriorityService:50)
        at com.atlassian.rm.jpo.rest.service.plan.CommonPlanInformationProvider.getIssuePriorityInformation(CommonPlanInformationProvider.java:340)
        at com.atlassian.rm.jpo.rest.service.plan.CommonPlanInformationProvider.getPlanInfo(CommonPlanInformationProvider.java:161)
        at com.atlassian.rm.jpo.plugin.views.simpleplans.data.SimplePlansInformationProvider.getData(SimplePlansInformationProvider.java:88)
        at com.atlassian.rm.jpo.plugin.views.simpleplans.data.SimplePlansInformationProvider.getData(SimplePlansInformationProvider.java:26)
...
{noformat}

A review of the stack trace and the corresponding code indicates that no Priority Scheme could be found for a Project. Given that a Project should always have a Priority Scheme this suggests the corresponding database records have become invalid.

h3. Workaround

1. Portfolio 3.17 introduces a check for a missing Priority Scheme for a Project and fails gracefully when this occurs. The permits the Plan to load. However issues in the affected Project will have an empty list of Priorities for this field (see attached screen shot: Degraded-Priority-Behaviour.png). So Portfolio behaviour is still degraded but much less so. If you are affected by this issue and in a position to upgrade, we recommend you do so.

2. For at least one customer, associating a new Priority Scheme with the affected Project(s) in the Plan resolved the issue. This is done configured through the Jira Administration menu, via Issues -> Priority Schemes.
fields.summary: Loading a Portfolio Plan fails and hangs indefinitely

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The Confluence Macro view when Sharing Roadmap can break when grouping by Release or Label.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Enter a Plan normal view
# Open View settings, set grouping to Release or Label
# Share the plan as Confluence
# Open the generated link in the new tab (w/ PortfolioRoadmapConfluence)

h3. Expected Results
The Plan rendered correctly.

h3. Actual Results
The Plan does not render, empty content. Browser's Console log throw the following error
{code}
com.atlassian.jpo:jpo-wr-page-portfolio-frontend-vendor-scripts.js:42 Invariant Violation: [React Intl] An `id` must be provided to format a message.
{code}
 
h3. Workaround
Avoid using Release or Label for grouping on the Plans that are to be shared to Confluence
fields.summary: Confluence macro view breaks when grouping by Release or Label

fields.description: Add context to the Team field and the possibility to select which teams should be available for each project.
fields.summary: Add context to the Team field and the possibility to select which teams should be available for each project.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, if an issue is blocking another issue (which is scheduled in the plan) but the blocking issue is not scheduled, Portfolio will not be showing any warning about the blocking issue.


h3. Suggested Solution

# Allow Portfolio to automatically schedule the blocking issue so it will be shown as blocking other issue or
# Add a feature in Portfolio to allow it to flag dependency issue even if the depending issue is not scheduled in the plan.


h3. Workaround 

* Manually schedule the blocking issue in the plan.
fields.summary: Schedule dependency issue

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Similar to the behavior described in [JSWSERVER-19785|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWSERVER-19785] where you are creating an issue in an epic the option for Epic is listed in the create dialogue but selecting the Epic fails as you cannot link an epic to an epic.   However in this scenario the initiative hierarchy levels (the level above an epic per portfolio hierarchy configurations) is also listed in the create dialogue as an option to be created as the level below the epic, but contrary to the Epic behavior the Initiative can be mapped to the Epic as the parent, in turn causing additional errors such as the BUG [JPOSERVER-2691|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOSERVER-2691] as a conflict occurs because the initiative cannot be both the parent and child of an Epic at the same time

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# make sure a hierarchical level above epic exists (initiative)
# Navigate to an existing Epic
# Use the "Create issue in epic" option

h3. Expected Results
Only standard issue types that are not mapped to an initiative hierarchy are listed in the issue type field. 

h3. Actual Results
The Initiative issue types are listed as avaliable issue types, along with Epic, and the Initiative can be selected and created as a child of the Epic
 
h3. Notes
As the Initiative is considered a standard issue type but mapped to the higher hierarchy levels by portfolio the mappings would be possible if Portfolio was disabled, so an additional Expectation could be that a warning or error would occur when a initiative issue type is selected noting the issue types are invalid because of hierarchy configurations

h3.Workaround
You can use the following JQL to identify issue in this state:
{code}
issuetype = "initiative"  AND "Epic Link" is not EMPTY 
{code}
perform Bulk Update to remove the Epic link
fields.summary: Create issue In Epic allows selection Of Initiatives as a child of the Epic

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
It is not possible to add the *Logged* field (the time logged on the issue via Jira time tracking) in the new Portfolio interface.
h3. Suggested Solution
Allow Portfolio users to pull the data of the field from Jira. 
h3. Workaround
* Create a new scripted custom field to copy the value from the Logged field in Jira time tracking and display in Portfolio
; or
* Use the old interface
; or
* Hover the issue in Portfolio to see an overview of the time estimates and logged time. 
!jpo_hover_issue_time.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Add the (time) Logged field to the new interface

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The Jira application has time tracking settings to configure the number of days in a week and the number of hours in a day among other settings.
The estimates for an issue can be set when the issue is created or updated and hence displayed in the Jira application as part of issue information.
Portfolio for Jira also shows the estimates for each issue as part of a Portfolio plan.  

The old interface (Portfolio 2.x) matched the way the Jira application shows the issue estimates, however the Portfolio for Jira version 3.x (improved interface) does not display the issue estimates in the same way as before and does not consider the Jira time tracking settings either.

\\
This issue has been found in Jira Portfolio version 3.11 and 3.14, however it is expected than all Portfolio 3.x (improved interface) releases are affected.


h3. Steps to reproduce

# Go to <HOST>:<PORT>/secure/admin/TimeTrackingAdming!default.jspa and check the Time Tracking setting in the Jira application.  The defaults are set to:
Number of working hours per day: 8
Number of working days per week: 5 
!JPO-2701_TestCase2_TT_1.png|thumbnail!
# Create an issue and set the  {{Original}} and {{Remaining}} estimates to "5d".
!JPO-2701_TestCase2_Issue1_2.png|thumbnail!
# Create a Portfolio plan that will include the issue created in the previous step and check that it shows the expected estimates in days.
!JPO-2701_TestCase2_Planwithcorrectestimates_3.png|thumbnail!
# <HOST>:<PORT>/secure/admin/TimeTrackingAdming!default.jspa and change the Time Tracking settings for "Number of working hours per day" to 5.
!JPO-2701_TestCase2_TT_changedto5hours_4.png|thumbnail!
# Go back to the Portfolio plan and check how the estimates are shown.
!JPO-2701_TestCase2_Plan_5.png|thumbnail!
# Check how the Jira issue displays the estimate fields after the change to the time tracking setting.  It is now 1w 3d which does not match how the Portfolio version 3 (improved interface) shows the estimates in days (still shows 5).
!JPO-2701_TestCase2_JiraView_6.png|thumbnail!
# Finally, Check how this is shown in the old interface Portfolio 2.x by changing it the the plan's configuration.  The old interface shows the estimates as the Jira application does. 
!JPO-2701_TestCase2_JPO_V2View_7.png|thumbnail!


h3. Actual Results

The improved interface (Portfolio 3.x) does not match how the Jira application shows the estimates for issues and the new interface (JPO 3.x) does not match how estimates are shown in JPO V2.x .

h3. Expected Results

Portfolio 3.x (improved interface) matches how estimates are shown in the Jira application as well as in the old interface (Portfolio 2.x).


h3. Workaround

The only available workaround (at the time the bug was created) is to set the estimates column to hours in the plan configuration.


\\
fields.summary: Jira Portfolio version 3.X interface doest not show the issues' estimates as they are shown in the Jira user interface when the estimates are set to days in the Portfolio plan.

fields.description:
h3. Definition
Just like other add-ons, it would be great if Jira Portfolio will be available in the left side Project settings for easy navigation.
!addon.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Make Jira Portfolio available on the left side panel

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

It is not possible to add a new blank scenario to a plan:

!Screen Shot 2019-11-19 at 1.36.33 pm.png|width=591,height=346!
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # With scenarios already enabled for a plan, go to the scenario management page
 # Click "Add scenario" button
 # Enter a scenario name

h3. Expected Results

It should be possible to create blank scenario
h3. Actual Results

The radio button and label for creating a blank scenario is missing and you are forced to copy from an existing scenario
h3. Workaround

Copy from an existing scenario and then discard all the changes (this results in a blank scenario)
fields.summary: Cannot add a new blank scenario

fields.description:
When using the auto-scheduler, sometimes you only want to use it to set the Team or Release of the issues in the plan. If you don't want to update one of the Team/Release/Sprint it is not possible to use the auto-schedule function at all.

So in addition to "All values" and "only empty values", it would be useful to have the option "Do not update".
fields.summary: It would be useful to have in addition to "All values" and "only empty values", it would be useful to have the option "Do not update".

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
If you end up having an Issue of a standard Issue Type and links a child issue of it as its Epic Link, you won't be able to load the Portfolio plan that these issues are in as it will load forever and crash the browser.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Have a standard issue of "Capability" Issue Type called Issue1 for example.
# Have an Epic of Epic issue type called Epic2 for example.
# Configure Issue1 to be parent of Epic2 (so Epic2 will be child of Issue1)
# Now, edit Issue1 to have Epic2 as it's Epic Link (so Issue1 will appear in the "Issues in Epic" gadget in Epic2 issue view)
# Try to access the plan these issues are in.

h3. Expected Results
The plan loads normally.
h3. Actual Results
It will load forever and either turn white, crash with "something went wrong" text or will ask if you want to stop the page or keep waiting for a response.

The below exception is thrown in browser error:
{code}Maximum call stack exceeded{code}

h3. Workaround
It is necessary to track down the issues causing the problem by removing it one by one from the plan that is crashing, which is not ideal for a lot of cases.
fields.summary: Linking a child issue as an Epic Link breaks the Portfolio plan

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

While reloading the plan page, the browser displays a blank page.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

I'm also able to reproduce it on my local (though not on jpos-latest), via these steps:
 # Add a custom field of type single select and enable filtering for it
 # Set field to different values in several issues
 # Filter on the field
 # Refresh the page

h3. Expected Results

Everything is fine.

h3. Actual Results

Page crashes. The error happens in /app-simple-plans/query/filters/custom-field-filter/index.js, line 96. The code is doing something with the custom field filter before the custom fields have been loaded into redux, resulting in an error.

h3. Workaround

Remove the Custom Field filtering and prevent using it until the bug is fixed.
fields.summary: Reloading Plan gets a blank page

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When creating an Epic under Initiative for two times, the Component field value does not copy over the second time around. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
* Go to Portfolio and select a Plan.
* In Roadmap view, set the Hierarchy level from Initiative to Sub-Task
* Create a few Initiatives group them by Components.
* In one of the Initiative, create two Epics under it.
* Review changes and save to Jira. 
* At the Plan view, notice where the Epics are grouped. 

h3. Expected Results
The Epics should inherit the Component value from the Initiative. 

h3. Actual Results
The second Epic did not inherit the Component value and is grouped under _All other issues_. 

h3. Workaround
Manually key in the Component field value to the second Epic.
fields.summary: Creating Epic from Initiative in Plan does not copy the Component value
Improve logging on Portfolio team field editablility

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
If you have multiple Target date fields (besides the 2 added by Portfolio) and restrict their context to a specific Project/Issue Type, Jira Portfolio won't commit changes to the Target date fields.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a custom Target Start Date field
 # Restrict new field's context to only 1 Issue Type
 # Make changes to the Target Start field (Default field) on your Portfolio plan
 # Commit changes

h3. Expected Results
New date is committed

h3. Actual Results
Portfolio doesn't throw any error and refreshes the date back to the original value before the change on step 3.

h3. Workaround
Set the custom field's context to all issue types
fields.summary: Can't commit Target date change when you have multiple Target date fields

fields.description:

h3. Workaround

Remove the epic link from the initiative.
fields.summary: If an Initiative is linked to an Epic with the Epic Link, and the same Epic is linked to the Initiative with the Parent Link - Portfolio cannot load the Plan

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When the user removes a release from a plan, it is also being removed from the cross project release that it is part of.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create Plan A which includes Board A
 # Create Plan B which includes Board A
 # Board A has Release A
 # Create a CPR in Plan A including Release A from Board A
 # Commit the change in plan A
 # In Plan B, exclude the Release A then
 # Commit the change in plan B.

h3. Expected Results

Release A is still part of the CPR in Plan A and is excluded in plan B.
h3. Actual Results

Release A is no longer part of the CPR in Plan A (but the release can be added again in the CPR) and is excluded in Plan B
h3. Note

The release should only be excluded if it's excluded from the issue source view.
h3. Workaround

None.
fields.summary: Removing a Release from a Plan, removes it from a Cross-Project Release
Show Epic Status field in the Initiative Child Issues panel

fields.description: As of today, permissions are based on the groups defined in the Global Permissions section. This should change to allow management by project roles to avoid scenarios where any user can delete a team, causing data loss. If this permission is modified to allow project roles to manage, potentially only project admins can be allowed to create and edit/delete teams.
fields.summary: Portfolio Permissions Include Project Roles

fields.description:
Looking for a triggered event to clear the Start & End dates when an issue is removed from a plan. A Very Common Scenario: If a Program Manager has a pivot in their Tetris planning and decided they need to remove items from their Tetris board... they can then select one or more issues and perform "Bulk action" to "Remove from plan", then there should be an immediate triggered action to remove any values from the Target Start and Target End fields.

This is important because we will be running queries on existing Portfolio Plans based on filled in Target dates... this will be part of the various imports we will be used for scheduling and resource management. It is vital we are not pulling in issues into our queries that are not on Portfolio Plans but are showing up because they have fields filled for Target Start / End. The route of asking Program Managers to delete Target dates prior to removing them from Plans is less than ideal and would impact adoptability.
fields.summary: Looking for a triggered event to clear the Start & End dates when an issue is removed from a plan.

fields.description:
h3. Definition
Currently, you can only configure 1 full day absence in the Shared teams and people configuration. 

h3. Suggestion
Under some circumstances, a team member needs to go on half-day leave. It would be great if this will be considered.
fields.summary: Ability to add half day absences

fields.description:
h3. Definition
In the _Improved interface_, this feature is not enabled by default and the users commonly thought that it's a product fault when the estimates are not summed up at the parent issue level.

h3. Suggestion
Have this feature enabled by default.
fields.summary: Make 'Show rolled-up values in fields' enabled by default

fields.description:
When estimating issues as the standard issue type level or lower, the values roll-up, but the preview values do not count as the actual estimation.

The preview still leaves the the estimate to be manually input, which could be useful, but in most cases the preview would be the accumulated total of estimated issues and is more or less an accurate estimation.

Please create a toggle-able feature that makes the preview the actual story point estimation value.
fields.summary: Allow rolled up values from sub-tasks to parents and higher to count as actual estimation as opposed to a "preview"

fields.description:
As of now, Portfolio allows for users to commit plan changes if an issue uses both Epic and Parent link, which is not ideal.

Suggestion is to improve error checking and handling and point out as warnings whenever an issue has both links used.
fields.summary: Portfolio should not commit changes if an issue has both parent and epic links

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

A single user can't create issues in a specific project when any of the Portfolio fields Team, Target start, target end etc. are present on the Create Issue screen.

h3. Environment

Looking into this it seems the component IssuePropertyServiceBridge74 from Portfolio (and also IssuePropertyServiceBridge80) do not check the result from IssuePropertyService.validateSetProperty().
The invalid result should have the reason for its invalidness attached.
The bridges should at least log the reason when !SetPropertyValidationResult.isValid(), as otherwise we get this unactionable exception.

This is in fact caused two bugs:

1a) IssuePropertyServiceBridge tries to perform the property update even though the validation said it was invalid. Instead it should either log an error or throw a proper exception with details
1b) com.atlassian.rm.teams.customfields.team.TeamCustomFieldType.createValue() should not validate permissions when creating the property. The IssuePropertyService does allow for that, but it's not completely exposed in the Portfolio components. This should be done.

fields.summary: User cannot create an issue in a project when not having the "Edit Issue" permission

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Jira portfolio plan view is not able to load and hangs for users. It happens to all different browsers. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce

Make 2 issues being mutual parents in the plan. For example, Issue A is issue B is parent issue. Issue B is issue A's parent issue. 

h3. Expected behavior

Portfolio plan view should be able to handle circular link issues properly and successfully load the plan view. 

h3. Actual behavior

Portfolio goes into an infinite loop and plan view is stuck.

h3. Workaround

Breaking circular dependency by removing parent for one of the issues resolve the issue.

h3. Note

How to identify circular linked issues from a har file https://confluence.atlassian.com/roadmaps-kb/how-to-identify-circular-linked-issues-from-advanced-roadmaps-plan-via-har-file-978213255.html
fields.summary: Unable to load plan view in Portfolio due to circular linked issues

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Currently, when required field is set for a project and users tries to create 2 or more issues in Portfolio, Portfolio will be prompting users to re-insert the values of the required field while creating the issue.


h3. Environment

* Portfolio 3.11
* Portfolio 3.4.0


h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Edit the Field Configuration used by the project included in the Portfolio plan.
# Set a field as required (Eg: Components).
# Open Portfolio plan.
# Add the field which is set as required to the scope view.
# Create a new issue on the plan. 
# Create a new child issue under the plan.
# Set the required field for both of the issues.
# Commit the changes.


h3. Expected Results

Portfolio creates both of the issues.


h3. Actual Results

Portfolio request user to fill in the detail for the required field again.


h3. Workaround

Enter the required field from the screen shown by Portfolio and commit the change.
fields.summary: Portfolio looking for required field

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When creating a CPR, it is possible to click 'create' in the CPR dialog having only entered the name, and not actually adding a cross-project release to the table. 

h3. Environment

Portfolio for Jira 3.9.0

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a Cross Project Release.
 # Add a *Name*
 # Click on *Create*.

h3. Expected Results

The Cross Project Release should not be created unless you have added the releases and the projects that are part of the project release, or the user should not be able to click on the *Create* button.

h3. Actual Results

The user can click on create and the following error is displayed.

!Screen Shot 2019-10-04 at 18.23.18.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

Add at least 2 projects and 2 releases to the Cross Project Release.
fields.summary: Creating an empty Cross-Project Release results in an error.

fields.description:
Some teams have a non-conventional hierarchy:
 * Program Epic --> Program Feature --> Product Feature --> Product Epic --> [DEFINED TEAM]
 ** DEFINED TEAM = Story --> Subtask
 *** Story = Story, Bug, Improvement, Task, Technical Debt

Teams like this would like a way to differentiate same issue types at different issue levels of the hierarchy by using JQL or some other mechanism.


 Example as shown above: Program Epic and Product Epic both use the same issue type “Epic” but they are at different levels of the hierarchy. Currently, there is no way to differentiate between the two when configuring the hierarchy.
fields.summary: Same issue types in hierarchy

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When a user configures a new Portfolio plan or edit an existing plan, they will be given an option to select specific version that they want to include in the plan. At the version selection plan, Portfolio displays the following message:

{quote}
Select the releases you want to track in your plan. Only the issues of selected releases will be included in the plan.
{quote}

However, in the next step, Portfolio will include issues without any version as well as issues with the selected version.


h3. Environment

* Jira Portfolio 3.11.0


h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Create a new version in a project and ensure that no issues have new version as Fix Version.
# Create a new plan.
# Use the project which the new version belongs to as the plan source.
# Select the newly created version.


h3. Expected Results

Portfolio only displays issues with the selected version in its fix version field.


h3. Actual Results

Portfolio will include both the issues with the selected version in its Fix Version field and also any issues without any Fix Version value.


h3. Workaround

Create a filter that only includes issues with a specific version and use it as the issue source.
fields.summary: Portfolio includes issues outside of the selected version

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, if an issue has more estimate than the remaining capacity, Portfolio will split the issue to multiple Sprints. Some users would like to turn off this feature and would like Portfolio to provide a hint to them that more resource is needed to complete the issue in a single Sprint.


h3. Suggested Solution

Allow users to prevent issues from being split to multiple Sprint and force them to be included in specific Sprint. Also Portfolio should provide some hints to what can be done to ensure that the issues are completed in the Sprint.


h3. Workaround 

None.
fields.summary: Allow Portfolio to hint users that issue is overbooked rather than splitting it

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
The REST API endpoint to delete Portfolio plans is present but not implemented. 
When you try to delete a plan via REST, you get the following: 
{code:borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#6A8EB3|bgColor=#F8F8F8}
$ curl -XDELETE -s -u username:password http://localhost:47133/j7133/rest/jpo-api/1.0/plan/5 | jq .
{
  "error": "unexpected-error",
  "errorMessages": [],
  "exception": {
    "type": "com.atlassian.rm.common.publicapi.exception.APIErrorCode$Exception",
    "message": "Delete operation not available!",
    "stackTrace": [
...
{code}
h3. Suggested Solution
Implement the DELETE method so plans can be deleted via the REST API endpoint. 
h3. Workaround
Delete plans from the GUI.
fields.summary: Implement the REST API endpoint to delete plans

fields.description: As a Jira admin, I'd like to define some colors across different plans based on a custom field value.
fields.summary: I'd like to define some colors across different plans based on a custom field value

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian status as of September 2019|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#B2D4FF | titleBGColor=#B2D4FF | bgColor=#EAF1FC}
Microsoft has not released any major updates for IE11 since 2015, and has [recently discouraged the use of IE11 as a default browser|https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/Windows-IT-Pro-Blog/The-perils-of-using-Internet-Explorer-as-your-default-browser/ba-p/331732].

To allow us to continue to take advantage of modern web standards to deliver improved functionality and the best possible user experience across all of our products, we have decided to end support for IE11. *Portfolio for Jira Server will end support when [the last IE11-supported version of Jira has reached end of life|https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Feedback-Forum-articles/Retiring-IE11-support-for-Atlassian-cloud-server-and-data-center/ba-p/1185312] (October 21, 2021).*

End of support means we will not fix bugs that are specific to IE11, and will begin to introduce features that aren't compatible with this browser.

Find out more about this change from our [announcement|https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Feedback-Forum-articles/Retiring-IE11-support-for-Atlassian-cloud-server-and-data-center/ba-p/1185312].

If you have questions or concerns about this change, please comment on this issue.

{panel}
fields.summary: Plans to end support for IE11

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
A large Program may consist of multiple Plans. An active project/Program may introduce new work and respective Plans along the lifetime of the project. These newly created (and related) Plan is expected to automatically included/associated with the existing Program for continuity and presentation of a whole project.

h3. Suggested Solution
* Add option to add to an existing Program on Plan creation
* Add a way to label a Plan and allow a Program to automatically include all Plan with the said label
 
h3. Workaround 
Manually add the Plan in Program setting
fields.summary: Automatically associate related Plan to Program

fields.description:
As part of organizing our work, and ensuring the distribution of the various types of work (themes – like Obsolescence), is to assign them themes which are all color coded.

We have a 14+ colors that are distinct so as to identify these projects on roadmaps, pie-charts, and any other dashboard graphical mechanism where we can see the various types of work each Portfolio, its Program(s) and their respective teams are working on.

As such, the limited colors and the limitation on the # of selectable colors (currently 12) may soon become an inhibitor to our ability to leverage Portfolio for JIRA for our Enterprise-wide replan / roadmapping activities.

More colors, or the ability to create custom colors would help in scaling this use case.
fields.summary: Provide more colors in "View Settings -> Color By"

fields.description:
Currently, Portfolio for Jira only supports the custom field types in [this list|https://confluence.atlassian.com/advancedroadmapsserver/custom-fields-967895171.html]:

{quote}
The following custom field types are supported:

    * checkbox
    * date picker
    * multiple-choice select
    * number
    * radio button
    * label
    * single-choice select
    * single-line text
    * URL (read-only)
    * user picker (single user)

{quote}

I would like Portfolio for Jira to support custom field types generated by third-party plugins.
fields.summary: Support for third-party application's custom field types.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Currently, if a user configured Portfolio with a Service Desk and tried to view the version of plan, Jira will throw the following error:

{quote}
Sorry, you can't view this page

This page is only available to Jira Software users. If you think you should be a Jira Software user, you should ask your administrator to give you application access to Jira Software.
{quote}

h3. Environment

* Jira Portfolio 3.9.0, 3.10.0

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Create a Service Desk and ensure there are issues and version in the project.
# Create a new Portfolio plan and configure the plan to use the Service Desk project as source.
# From the scope, click on the green circle to view the detail of the version.
# Click on "View in Jira"


h3. Expected Results

* Jira shows the version page.


h3. Actual Results

Jira shows the following warning message:

{quote}
Sorry, you can't view this page

This page is only available to Jira Software users. If you think you should be a Jira Software user, you should ask your administrator to give you application access to Jira Software.
{quote}

h3. Workaround

* Edit the URL shown from the Portfolio manually from 
{code}
<Jira URL>/projects/DSD2/versions/<version ID>
{code}
to 
{code}
<Jira URL>/browse/DSD2/fixforversion/<version ID>
{code}
fields.summary: Viewing version does not work with Service Desk project

fields.description:
Currently, it appears the field columns added in Portfolio are cached to the Browser. Meaning other users do not see the Plan in this way, and these fields do not appear if using another browser or after a cache clear.

We would like to be able to customize a plan view, with fields such as add "Progress (story points)" and "Release" as columns to their plan, and users would see this same view when they visited the plan, instead of having to add the fields themselves.
fields.summary: Allow configuring field columns as a Plan setting, and have them appear in Plan for all users by default.

fields.description:
h5. Problem Definition
At the moment, in the new improved interface, selecting a sprint will auto populate the target dates (target start and target end). However, selecting a release/version will not auto populate the target dates, even if the release/version has fixed dates.

h5. Suggested Solution
It would be great to have the target dates populated automatically when the release/version is selected. So users will have an overview on the time frame of each item.
fields.summary: Auto Populate Target date fields when release/version is selected

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

In the old Portfolio experience, if an issue has both a scheduled date and a target date, when applying a schedule range filter the target date is prioritised over the scheduled date.

 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to any plan with an issue which has scheduled start or end dates
 # Give the issue a target start before the scheduled start, or a target end after scheduled end
 # Apply a filter which encompasses the scheduled dates, but excludes the target dates

h3. Expected Results

The issue should honour the scheduled dates only, and be present in the timeline
h3. Actual Results

The issue is excluded when the target date sits outside of the applied range filter

 
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Filtering by schedule range does not honour scheduled dates

fields.description:
Once you run a JQL search for issues, you can choose to display the "Parent Link" column, which will display the link between initiatives and epics, for instance. 


As a Jira admin, I would like to search for all Initiative issues from a project and be able to obtain their child links in a search query result.

Currently, "Parent Link" is available as a column to include in the search result. However, "Child Link" is not available to be added as a result column.
fields.summary: As a Jira admin I would like to be able to see the "Child link" as well as the "Parent Link" on JQL results and filters.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Doing a Bulk Move of issues to a new project will maintain the Parent Link field mapping in the Portfolio Plan but the field will be returned blank when viewed in the issue navigator

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create Two Projects with matching configurations and boards (can use create with shared configurations to simplify)
# Create a plan connected to Board 1
#* add some Initiatives, Epics, and stories to the first project with epics mapped to the Initiatives and stories to the Epics make
# Run a JQL to see the issue in project 1
# Add parent link column in issue navigator to verify value is present
# Bulk move all issues in project 1 to project 2
# Change board 1s filter to include issues from project 2
# Compare Issue navigators results to plan

h3. Expected Results
All data is mapped correctly and parent Link is present in both location

h3. Actual Results
The Plan maintains the mappings and shows a value correctly for the parent link field with the new issues in the new project, but the parent link field is blank in the issue navigator and the value cannot be recovered

The Plan also show the Uncommitted changes Icon on the commit button but viewing the "Review and commit changes" page is blank

h3.Notes:
Tested this on Portfolio version 3.9.0, with Both the New Interface and Live plan view

When moving a single issue the parent link is correctly visible in both locations this only occurs when bulk moving the full Initiative / Epic / Story hierarchy chain

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Bulk Move causes Parent Link to break

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

With Portfolio 3.4 & 3.6, we have updated Portfolio related permission:

* https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiraportfolio/portfolio-for-jira-3-6-release-notes-973500145.html
* https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiraportfolio/portfolio-for-jira-3-4-release-notes-972345867.html

In Portfolio 3.4:

{quote}
The following are now able to access any private plans in Portfolio for Jira:

Users with the Portfolio for Jira administrator permission
Users with the Jira administrators global permission, since these users are automatically made Portfolio for Jira administrators
Jira administrators
System administrators
{quote}

In Portfolio 3.6:

{quote}
Enhanced plan permissions
Building upon the user permission updates released in Portfolio for Jira 3.4, we're now further enhancing restricted user permissions in Portfolio.

Even if restricted users are able to edit issue details in the plans that they have access to, they cannot save any of these changes from Portfolio to Jira. See Permissions in Portfolio for Jira for more details.
{quote}

However, since the Portfolio Viewer description from "Portfolio Permission" remains the same, some users are not aware of the changes.


h3. Suggested Solution

Update the Portfolio Viewer description to reflect the recent changes.
fields.summary: Update Portfolio Viewer description

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When a user sets the due date and target date to the same day, Portfolio will show the following error and user will be unable to commit the changes:

 !Screenshot 2019-09-02 at 7.11.27 PM.png|thumbnail! 


h3. Environment

Jira Portfolio 3.9.X


h3. Steps to Reproduce
 
# Create an issue in plan.
# Expose "Due Date" in the scope.
# Set a due date value.
# Set the same day in the "Target End" field.


h3. Expected Results

Jira does not show any warning and user is able to commit the changes.


h3. Actual Results

Jira shows the warning below and user is able to commit the changes:

 !Screenshot 2019-09-02 at 7.11.27 PM.png|thumbnail! 


h3. Workaround

# Update the Due Date to 1 day later than the Target End date or 
# Update the Target End to 1 day before then the Target End date.
fields.summary: Setting same date for Target End and Due Date will trigger warning

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Leaving team capacity blank resulted in Portfolio schedule issues using default 200 weekly hours. 

h3. Environment

- Portfolio improved interface

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new plan with the Kanban team type. 
# Populate some Stories with their estimation. 
# Under the team capacity, you will see something like below: 
 !Screenshot 2019-08-30 at 6.43.11 PM.png|thumbnail!  !Screenshot 2019-08-30 at 6.43.27 PM.png|thumbnail! 
# Do the auto-schedule and you will see Portfolio scheduling using 200 hours instead of 40: 
 !Screenshot 2019-08-30 at 6.45.04 PM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results

The Portfolio is scheduling using the shown 40 weekly hours. 

h3. Actual Results

The Portfolio is scheduling using the default 200 weekly hours. 

h3. Notes

- Only happens in KANBAN team type in the Improved Interface. 

h3. Workaround

Explicitly set the team capacity will overwrite the default 200 weekly hours.
fields.summary: Leaving team capacity blank resulted in Portfolio schedule issues using default 200 weekly hours

fields.description:
*Context:*

A recurring problem is that Portfolio is unable to import new releases due to the LexoRank length limitation.  See [JPO-3334|https://getsupport.atlassian.com/browse/JPO-3334] and [JPO-3482|https://getsupport.atlassian.com/browse/JPO-3482].

This is a silent failure:
 * Users would typically report that they can not seeing new releases when editing the issues sources.
 * The only indication of this problem is a single error in the Jira application logs.

Example error message in logs:
{code:java}
[c.a.r.c.b.agile.rank.AgileRankOperationResponse] Agile call returned errors: -171665=ErrorCollection[errors=[ErrorCollection.ErrorItem[contextId=<null>,messageKey=gh.lexorank.service.error.reindex.required,params={}]],reasons=[CONFLICT]]
XXXX-XX-XX XX:XX:XX,XXX http-nio-8080-exec-XXX ERROR XXXXX XXXXXXXXXXXXXX XXXXXX XXX.XXX.XXX.XXX,XXX.XXX.XXX.XXX /rest/jpo/1.0/plan/setup/projects [c.a.r.j.env.rank.BaseJiraEnvironmentRankService] 
com.atlassian.rm.common.bridges.agile.rank.BatchAgileRankException
	at com.atlassian.rm.common.bridges.agile.rank.AgileRankOperationResponse.create(AgileRankOperationResponse.java:44)
	at com.atlassian.rm.common.bridges.agile.InternalAgileRankService.rankLast(InternalAgileRankService.java:92)
	at com.atlassian.rm.common.bridges.agile.BaseAgileRankServiceBridgeJpo.rankLast(BaseAgileRankServiceBridgeJpo.java:38)
	at com.atlassian.rm.common.bridges.agile.AgileVersionDomainRankServiceBridgeJpo.rankLast(AgileVersionDomainRankServiceBridgeJpo.java:11)
	at com.atlassian.rm.jpo.env.rank.BaseJiraEnvironmentRankService.rankLast(BaseJiraEnvironmentRankService.java:53)
	at com.atlassian.rm.jpo.core.rank.BaseKeyRankService.stackUnknown(BaseKeyRankService.java:102)
	at com.atlassian.rm.jpo.core.rank.DefaultVersionDomainKeyRankService.stackUnknown(DefaultVersionDomainKeyRankService.java:11)
	at com.atlassian.rm.jpo.core.version.VersionOrderService.stackUnknownEnviromentVersions(VersionOrderService.java:43)
	at com.atlassian.rm.jpo.core.project.ProjectService.getDeepProjects(ProjectService.java:104)
	at com.atlassian.rm.jpo.core.project.ProjectService.getDeepProjectsById(ProjectService.java:81)
	at com.atlassian.rm.jpo.core.issuesource.context.DefaultIssueSourceContextService.getProjectInfosForIssueSources(DefaultIssueSourceContextService.java:61)
	at com.atlassian.rm.jpo.rest.service.plan.setup.projects.PlanSetupProjectsRestEndpoint.getProjects(PlanSetupProjectsRestEndpoint.java:51)
...
{code}
 

Atlassian's online documentation for [Managing LexoRank|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver075/managing-lexorank-935391800.html] only covers the standard issue rank field, and does not address the virtual fields added by Portfolio.

 

*Suggestion:*
 * Report the problem to the user instead of a silent failure.
 * Provide the administrator the means to monitor and manage Portfolio's virtual fields.
fields.summary: Improve user experience with Lexo Rank length problem

fields.description:
Currently, if a status is mapped to "done" in JIRA but doesn't have a resolution post function or the workflow associated to the project or issue type removes the resolution on transition, the issue will NOT show in Portfolio, unless the child issue is in progress or to do. It would be nice if Portfolio ignored the resolution date when brining in issues. 
Expecting all of our customers to use canned workflows and resolutions on done statuses is very "perfect world JIRA". 
We have [documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiraportfolioserver/viewing-work-960719431.html] on this but it is one line: 

bq. Any issues that have been marked as done in Jira Software, that don't have a resolution set, will not be included in the plan.

It is confusing for end users and adds technical debt for JIRA admins to open a ticket with Atlassian to run down what the issue might be.
fields.summary: Allow issues with statuses mapped to done without resolutions

in the preview mode, should display  'sprint new + 1 complete sprint',

 * create an issue with team, sprint, story points assigned

 # create a plan based on scrum project with active and future sprint
 # create estimated story
 # create estimated task
 # Auto-schedule (note that at this point sprint should be shown as assigned to both story and task)

 - Sprint is only saved for the story. For the task, sprint stays empty.

h3. Actual Results
 - Sprint should also be assigned to the task.

Releases indicator shows green when sprint inferred date is beyond release end date

fields.description:
When the auto-schedule mode is run, the count at the top of the screen showing how many issues will be changed due to the scheduler only shows the number of currently visible (i.e not filtered out) issues that will change.

This is incorrect as the whole plan will still be optimised, and changes to issues applied even if they are not currently visible inside the plan (due to being filtered out)

Reproduce:
 # Enter auto-schedule mode
 # Change hierarchy filter
 # Number of changes to be made changes

Expected:

Total number of changes (event those not visible) will be shown at the top.
fields.summary: Auto schedule changes count is dependent on hierarchy rather than all changes

fields.description:
At this moment, the view settings on a Plan (like sort order, filter, group By, Color) are not saved for users. 
It would be nice if there was a way to save view settings per plan so that users are able to view the same settings when they switch browsers or share the plan with a team.
fields.summary: View settings on a Plan are not saved for users

fields.description:
h3. Definition
Child issues are missing in the Plan but checking all the basic factors returned negative until the child issues of that missing child issue were checked. In the issue sources page, the missing child issue is unticked.
!missing.png|thumbnail!

and further checking reveals that it has a child issue from a project that is not included in the issue sources. 

h3. Suggestion
Have a warning when adding these issues in the Plan that it has child issues/subtasks excluded in the issue sources.
fields.summary: Warning if a Child issue belongs to an excluded project in the Plan

fields.description:
h3. Summary

These custom field types are supported by Live Plans (old interface) but not supported by the Improved Interface:
 # Date Time Picker
 # Select List - Cascading

h3. Steps to reproduce
 # Create a Live Plan and add the above field types
 -> The fields are visible in the plan (/)
 # Switch the plan to Improved Interface

h3. Expected behavior

The fields are supported and visible in the plan
h3. Actual behavior

The fields become Unsupported and are not displayed in the plan
h3. Workaround

Use Live Plan instead
h3. Note

This may be an intended behavior as per [JPO Server - Custom fields|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiraportfolioserver/custom-fields-967895171.html], but it should be explained why those field types are no longer supported and whether there's a plan to support them in the Improved Interface.
fields.summary: Provide Custom Field support for date-time picker, cascade select-list and multi-text

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

If a Program has a {{AO_D9132D_SOLUTION}} record with STATE == 'RUNNING', the Program will not be able to be Synced. 

Instead of the “Calculate” / "Sync" button appearing, instead “Calculate program… 0% completed” / "Syncing program... 0% completed" appears.

In addition, when configuring the program, Jira raises the following exception message:
{code:java}
Exception Details
this.ui.calculationStatus.hide is not a function
TypeError: this.ui.calculationStatus.hide is not a function
at a.showCalculationInProgress <snip> {code}
 

 
h3. Steps to Reproduce

(*) While we have seen this issue present in the wild, it is currently unknown how this issue manifests with normal use. So far, we have only been able to cause the symptoms by manually editing the {{AO_D9132D_SOLUTION}} table
 # Create a Plan with a test Epic
 # Create a Program and link it to the Plan created
 # Update AO_D9132D_SOLUTION row for the Plan and set State = 'RUNNING'
 # Attempt to sync the Program

h3. Expected Results

The plan is able to be synced, as per normal. 
h3. Actual Results

Instead of the “Calculate” / "Sync" button appearing, instead “Calculate program… 0% completed” / "Syncing program... 0% completed" appears. The condition is not cleared even if all plans are removed from the program and re-added. 

 
h3. Workaround

Clear the problematic rows from the database using the following queries.
 # Remove Assignment_Ext records from the database that are associated with the problematic Program
{code:java}
DELETE FROM "AO_D9132D_ASSIGNMENT_EXT"
WHERE "SOLUTION_ID" IN (SELECT "ID"
     FROM "AO_D9132D_SOLUTION"
     WHERE "STATE" = 'RUNNING');{code}

 # Finally, remove the Solution rows that are stuck in the RUNNING state
{code:java}
DELETE FROM "AO_D9132D_SOLUTION" WHERE "STATE" = 'RUNNING';{code}

 # Refresh the Program. Check that the program is now able to be calculated
fields.summary: Program fails to calculate if associated Plan stuck on state 'RUNNING'

fields.description:
*Context:*

Currently, Portfolio Administrators (who are not Jira administrators) have a poor experience when they try to administrate Portfolio.

There are two major problems that prevent them from accessing Portfolio's administrative functions.

*1. With websudo enabled*

When websudo is enabled, non Jira administrators cannot navigate to admin pages.
This is a know Jira issue, see: [JPOSERVER-383|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOSERVER-383] and [JRASERVER-63047|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-63047]

*2. With websudo disable*

When websudo is disabled, non Jira administrators can only navigate to the Portfolio Permissions page.
This is because the menu options are rendered on Jira's `admin_plugins_menu` web-section, which has a condition to only allow Jira administrators.

Extract from Jira-core project, in `jira-components/jira-core/src/main/resources/webfragment/system-admin-sections.xml`:.
{code}
    <!-- PLUGINS MENU -->
    <web-section key="admin_plugins_menu" name="Plugins Menu" location="system.admin.top.navigation.bar"
                 i18n-name-key="webfragments.admin.menu.section.project.name" weight="130">
        <label key="admin.menu.system.plugins"/>
        <condition class="com.atlassian.jira.plugin.webfragment.conditions.UserIsAdminCondition"/>
    </web-section>
{code}

We won't be able to change Jira's `admin_plugins_menu`, since it will introduce security vulnerabilities in Jira.


*Suggestion:*

Provide the means to access Portfolio's administrative functions to Portfolio Administrators (who are not Jira administrators).
fields.summary: Improve portfolio administrator experience

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When creating an issue, after selecting the Epic field, there will be warning messages below "Target start" & "Target end".

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Add the following fields to the Issue Create screen: *Epic Link*, *Target start* and *Target end*.
# When creating a new issue, select an existing epic in the *Epic Link* field.

h3. Expected Results
No warnings will be displayed on the issue create screen.

h3. Actual Results
A warning will be displayed under both *Target start* and *Target end* indicating that the issue cannot have a Parent Link while an Epic Link exists.

h3. Workaround
The error message is misleading and can be safely ignored - it will go away once a value is inserted on any of the two affected fields.
fields.summary: Unexpected parent link warnings in issue create screen

fields.description:
In the plan view in Portfolio, if you want to select a specific field to appear on the scope you must click on the ellipses button on the fields column. The issue here is that this dropdown to select the fields loads all the existing custom fields on the instance.

One of the problems is that the "Add Custom Field" button is on the bottom of the list so you must scroll down through all the fields to get to the button.

The suggestion is to make Portfolio only show fields related to the projects/boards that are the source of that plan.
fields.summary: Field selection in plan gets all existing custom fields.

fields.description:
*Steps to reproduce:*
 * Create a plan based on scrum board.
 * create an issue with team, sprint, story points assigned
 * Unassign issue source from the team
 * Auto-schedule (Override only empty sprint values)

*Actual results:*
 * Sprint value is being cleared
 * See attached video for more details

*Expected results:*
 * Even though the issue source is not assigned, Auto-schedule shouldn't unassign sprint, especially if override option is not enabled

h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Auto-schedule unassigns sprints if the team has no issue source

fields.description:
*Steps to reproduce:*
 * Create a plan based on scrum board.
 * create a dynamic release (without fixed end date)
 * create an issue with the release and story points assigned
 * Auto-schedule (Override only empty release values)

 

*Actual results:*
 * Release value is shown as unassigned in the preview mode despite that backlog response contain assignment with the release
 * After accepting changes the release is actually not unassigned.
 * See attached video for more details

 

*Expected results:*
 * Auto-schedule preview mode shouldn't unassign the release, especially if override option is not enabled
 

h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Auto-schedule preview mode shows dynamic release as unassigned

fields.description:
As a portfolio plan user

I would like to not have to specify individual projects & releases for cross-project releases in the new experience

So that I can create new releases for all projects included in the portfolio plan
fields.summary: Add Cross-Project Release Creation For All Projects Under Portfolio Plan In the New Experience

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When an issue with a Parent Link value is edited and Epic Link value is set to it, the issue will no longer visible from the plan under its parent issue.

Jira prevents users from adding Epic Link to the issues with Parent Link with the following warning in issue screen:

{quote}
Cannot use parent link when epic link is set.
{quote}

However, user still allowed to add Epic Link to the issue with Parent Link. Jira should prevent users from adding Parent Link to the issues with Epic Link


h3. Environment

Jira 8.X
Jira Portfolio 3.X


h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Configure 2 extra levels in Portfolio hierarchy: L1 (highest) and L2 (below L2).
# Expose "Parent field" to Jira.
# Create a new issue with the issue type associated with L1 hierarchy (eg: TEST-1).
# Create a new issue with the issue type associated with L2 hierarchy (eg: TEST-2).
# Set TEST-1 as parent issue of TEST-2 using the parent link field.
# Open a plan which shows both of the issues.
# shows ticket T2 as child issue
# Ticket TEST-2 shows ticket TEST-1 as parent
# Now add ticket TEST-2 to an Epic TESTEPIC-1
# TEST-1 will be removed as parent link in TEST-2 issue page.
# TEST-2 will not be displayed as child issue of TEST-1 in the plan as well.


h3. Expected Results

Portfolio should prevent users from adding the Epic Link to the issues with Parent Link value.


h3. Actual Results

One Epic Link is added, Jira hides the Parent Link value which prevents Portfolio from recognizing TEST-1 as parent issue of TEST-2
 

h3. Workaround

Ensure that the issues with Epic Link do not have parent link value.
fields.summary: Setting Epic Link for issues with Parent Issue value break issue link

fields.description:
h3. Definition

In the old interface, we are able to define how many hours is equivalent to one story point in the _Issue Sources_ configuration. However, it seems to be missing in the improved interface.

h3. Suggestion
Re-introduce this conversion back to the improved interface.
fields.summary: Convert Story Points to Hours in Portfolio's Improved Interface

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When the instance has a large user base, when searching for a user in the bulk assignee field, users are not auto completed correctly
h3. Environment

Reproduced in:

JPO 3.5.0

Jira 8.2.2

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Have around 9000 to 10000 users. 
# Go to plan, select all issue and search for user John Eg: "Joh".

h3. Expected Results

All users with "Joh" appear

h3. Actual Results

 Few or no users appear although a lot more should

h3. Notes
* If we then select the search for assignee individually for an issue Eg: "Joh". Here all users with "Joh" appear
* Now if you go back to the bulk assign, it now shows all the users for "Joh"

h3. Workaround

Search for the user first in an individual user assignee field. This would load the results to the client side. Then search for the user in the bulk assignee. This should then work.
fields.summary: When the instance has a large user base, when searching for a user in the bulk assignee field, users are not auto completed correctly

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The [Portfolio REST API documentation|https://docs.atlassian.com/portfolio-for-jira-server/REST/2.13.0/teams/] does not reflect accurately what is implemented in Portfolio for Jira Server. 

For example, it has been identified so far that the documentation incorrectly states that the following actions are possible:
 * Creating Programs, Plans, and Hierarchy
 * Updating Programs, Plans, Hierarchy

 

 
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: The REST documentation is incorrect

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
JIRA Portfolio 3.6.0 in JIRA 8.2 custom fields name is on its translation key like below:
* *rm.jpo.plan.common.baselineEnd*
* *rm.jpo.plan.common.baselineStart*

h3. Environment
JIRA 8.2 (Portflio 3.6)

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Install JIRA 8.2 with JIRA Portfolio 3.6
# Navigate to _JIRA Administration > Issues > Custom Fields_
# Search for the field "Target"

h3. Expected Results
"Target End" and "Target Start" should be shown

h3. Actual Results
Nothing will be shown because the name is set to the translation key. Searching "rm" will show the following fields:
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Notes
The issue is caused by a bug affecting JIRA Core which is the platform where Portfolio is installed. 

h3. Workaround
-
fields.summary: JIRA Portfolio Custom Field Name is using the Translation key instead

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

User unable to create a resource using API. When they created the resource by following steps [here|https://docs.atlassian.com/portfolio-for-jira-server/REST/3.3.0/teams/#tag-person], Jira showing incorrect user ID and they are unable to view the person detail.


h3. Environment

* Jira 8.2.3
* Jira Portfolio 3.5.1


h3. Steps to Reproduce

# List the team using {{<JIRA's URL>/rest/teams-api/1.0/team}} REST API call. This can be done by copy-pasting in the browser.
# List the users using {{<JIRA's URL>/rest/teams-api/1.0/person}} REST API call. This can be done by copy-pasting in the browser.
# Create a resource. We can do this using CURL command or Postman. For testing, I used Postman. Refer to the content shown in the screenshot: [^Screenshot 2019-07-15 at 6.23.16 PM.png]
# Run the {{<JIRA's URL>/rest/teams-api/1.0/resource}} REST call again and we'll see that the person ID does not match the person id inserted with the previous REST call.
# Run the {{<JIRA's URL>/rest/teams-api/1.0/person}} REST call again and we'll see the following stack trace: [^JPO-resource.txt] 


h3. Expected Results

* Resource created with correct person ID.


h3. Actual Results

* Resource created with incorrect person ID and user unable to the person list.


h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Public Team REST API handles resource creation incorrectly

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
 * It's difficult to understand how much investment they put into a certain type of work. 
 * The Theme report is only available in Portfolio for Jira Live plans: To view the distribution of work over different 'Themes' assigned to an issue. Broken down by Target (user defined %), Estimated (based on estimated issues assigned with 'Themes'), and Actual (distribution of 'Theme' for Completed issues).
 * The 3.0 improved experience has removed Themes, opting to provide more flexibility with labels/components/custom fields for the values that Themes provided.

h3. Suggested Solution
 * Add a view / report so users can replicate the same value that was provided by 2.0's Theme report 'pie graph' (w/ Target, Estimated & Actual breakdown)
 * With the removal of 'Themes' as a field in the 3.0 experience, make this flexible to be able to use labels/components/custom fields.
fields.summary: Replicate the 'Themes' report into the 3.0 Improved experience

fields.description: Adding an 'Original Capacity' field would be important and useful at-a-glance information. This let's us know the user was given the max possible capacity when the Sprint was planned and started - as the 'Planned Capacity' changes over time.
fields.summary: In Capacity view, add 'Original Capacity' field to hover box

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Parent Link field doesn't have auto suggest implemented. Therefore you currently only have the Parents links shown if no input is specified in the field or if you provide the exact issue summary of the parent.

h3. Suggested Solution
 
As with the Epic Link field, implement Auto Suggest for the parent link field.
fields.summary: Parent Link field doesn't have auto suggest implemented
Parent-Child Link IssueLinkType may be duplicated when upgrading past 2.20

{code}

h3. Workaround
Set a default priority in your Jira instance, then Portfolio should load and work flawlessly. To do that::
# go to Jira Administration -> Issues -> (Under Issue Attributes) Priorities
# set any of the priority a default one.
fields.summary: Plan doesn't load on Jira 7.5.3 when default priority is not set

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently issues can only be manually excluded from the plan.  Admins may want to only show issues with parent epics. 

h3. Suggested Solution
 
Provide an option/filter to only include with parent epic
fields.summary: As an admin, I would like Portfolio to automatically exclude all issues without parent epic from the plan

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Similar to JRASERVER-2997, Team field as a custom field is not visible on a View Issue screen if it doesn't contain any value. Only when the issue is edited and a value is given to the field will it become visible.

(i) This is related to JPOSERVER-1847 as well.

h3. Suggestion

Admins should be able to choose whether the field should always be visible. Take note that:
* For JIRA Service Desk, _Request participants_ and _Organizations_ are always visible even when empty
* It's possible to always display the Sub-tasks panel by setting this parameter in JIRA_Home/jira-config.properties:
{code}jira.view.issue.show.quicksubtask.when.no.subtasks=true{code}
So perhaps a similar config can be enabled for Team field.
fields.summary: Allow Team field to be visible even when empty

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

It's not possible to give feedback on Portfolio programs via the in-product feedback form. Clicking *giving feedback* does not pop any form.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Activate the Portfolio new experience.
 # Create a program and browse it.
 # In the top right corner, click on *Help us improve programs by +giving feedback+*

h3. Expected Results

Feedback form should pop-up
h3. Actual Results

No feedback form pops-up
h3. Workaround

Use the feedback button on plans by clicking Give feedback.
fields.summary: Feedback form not available on Portfolio programs

fields.description:
The use case is in order to track growth, and are unable to do so without having a base line. We have created custom fields, but portfolio will not sum them like it will Original Story Points and Story Points. Additionally, the Original Story Points field no longer exists in the new experience. This could feasibly be replaced by a custom field that represents a number value, and could be summed up.

If Portfolio had the ability to sum custom fields - it would be an absolute game changer.
fields.summary: Create custom field that will sum up

fields.description: Add release column to the Program scope
fields.summary: Release column for the Program Scope view
